abstract: Dollar General offered to buy Family Dollar Stores for $8.9 billion, hoping to break up its fellow deep-discount retailer Family Tree’s agreed-upon $8.5 billion merger with Family Dollar.
snippet: Dollar General offered to buy Family Dollar Stores for $8.9 billion, hoping to break up its fellow deep-discount retailer Family Tree’s agreed-upon $8.5 billion merger with Family Dollar.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:30 p.m. | As more struggling Americans hit the bargain bins to get by, a bidding war is brewing for one of the country’s biggest deep-discount retailers.

headline.main: Rival Bids for Family Dollar Stores as Retailers Fight to Sell to Working Poor
headline.print_headline: Another Player Stirs Up Dollar Store Merger Fray

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Nelson D. Schwartz
